message.entry: Two for loop index names are required for an 'interchange' transform.
''{0}'' transform must be immediately followed by a for loop.

Class ''{1}'' contains a constant property ''{0}'' that is initialized with a coder.loop.Control object. Initialization of constant class properties with coder.loop.Control objects is not supported for code generation.
Applying coder.loop.Control transforms to a parfor loop is not supported in code generation.
Applying coder.loop.Control transforms to a for loop specified with coder.unroll is not supported in code generation.

Code generation failed to compute a constant value for this coder.loop.Control object. Did you mean to specify ''{0}'' or ''{1}''? Check whether assignments to this coder.loop.Control object are in an if/switch statement with a non-constant condition. When using an if/switch statement to specify transforms to a coder.loop.Control object, the condition must be a constant.
For loop index name ''{0}'' is referenced by more than one coder.loop.Control object.

Code generation failed to compute a constant value for this coder.loop.Control object. Check whether assignments to this coder.loop.Control object are in an if/switch statement with a non-constant condition. When using an if/switch statement to specify transforms to a coder.loop.Control object, the condition must be a constant.
For-loop index name provided to a coder.loop.Control transform must be a constant string or character vector.
The tileSize provided to coder.loop.tile must be a constant positive integer.
The unrollFactor provided to coder.loop.unrollAndJam must be a constant positive integer.
Code generation is unable to determine a constant list of for-loop index names.
''{0}'' a for loop with index name ''{1}'' that has a conflicting coder.loop.''{0}''('never') directive is not supported.
Passing 'never' as a for loop index name to ''{0}'' is not supported.
Multiple for loop index names passed to ''{0}''. Use ''{0}'' with either ''{1}'' or ''{2}''.
For loop index name ''{0}'' passed to ''{1}'' not found.
''{0}'' with input ''{1}'' conflicts with value ''{2}'' provided before.
For loop index name ''{0}'' already exists. Provide a different outer loop index name to 'tile'.
